entertainment.name: 观远足道养生SPA (Chongqing Jiefangbei Center NO.5 Store)
entertainment.location: Near Jiefangbei Square/Raffles City, Yuzhong District, Chongqing
entertainment.notes: Part of biggest spa chain in Chongqing, operates 24 hours. Walking distance from Raffles Hotel. Recommended after hotpot dinner. Booking recommended via phone or walk-in. Cost estimate: 200-400 RMB per person for full massage package.

entertainment.name: UNDEFINE (M50 Art District)
entertainment.notes: Quiet artistic cafe in M50 Art District. High-ceiling industrial design. Second floor especially quiet. Perfect for INFJ personality. Cost: ~30-50 RMB per person.

entertainment.name: 集雅 GATHERING (Wukang Road)
entertainment.notes: Unique Chinese aesthetic cafe with traditional tea house style. Features bamboo lanterns, landscape paintings, Chinese courtyard. Perfect for INFJ, quiet and cultural.

entertainment.name: Captain Bar (Rooftop)
entertainment.location: Above Captain Hostel, near The Bund, Shanghai
entertainment.notes: Rooftop bar with front-row views of the Bund skyline. More affordable than most Bund bars without velvet rope attitude. Cost: ~100-150 RMB per person for drinks.

entertainment.name: 叁叁 Sansan Cafe (near Huaihai Road)
entertainment.notes: Small quiet shop near Huaihai Road. Peaceful inside despite busy streets. Warm, relaxing atmosphere. Perfect for INFJ personality.

entertainment.name: Begonia (near Shanghai Book City)
entertainment.notes: Tiny minimalist cafe with black, white, gray aesthetic. Upstairs area with windows for quiet reading. Perfect combination with indie bookstore shopping.

entertainment.name: 只此青绿 (A Panorama of Rivers and Mountains)
entertainment.location: National Centre for the Performing Arts (Opera House), No.2 West Chang'an Avenue, Xicheng District, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Famous Chinese dance drama. IMPORTANT: Show ran Jan 30-Feb 4, 2025. Need to verify 2026 schedule. Booking hotline: 010-66552100. Official website: chncpa.org. Tickets: 180-980 RMB. Book 1-2 months in advance. Dress code: smart casual. Duration: ~2 hours. Performance may not be available on Feb 22, 2026 - requires confirmation.

entertainment.name: Millennium Dance Complex Beijing
entertainment.location: E02-TAOCI 3rd Street, 798 Art Zone, Chaoyang District, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Foreigner-friendly dance studio with English classes. Styles: Urban, Hip Hop, Popping, Locking, House, Jazz, Waacking, Heels, Contemporary. Registration for classes. Website: www.millennium-china.com/beijing. Cost: ~150-300 RMB per class or membership packages available.

entertainment.name: Zaha Club (嘉禾舞社) - Alternative Option
entertainment.location: Multiple locations: Yonghegong (6/F Aerospace Materials Building), Zizhu Bridge, Wangjing, Guomao, Chaoyangmen
entertainment.notes: China's biggest dance company with 8 studios in Beijing. Founded 2004. Phone: 186 1292 8880. Website: jiahewushe.com. WeChat: zahaclub. Offers intensive training program. Coaches include foreigners. Cost: ~200-400 RMB per class or membership.

entertainment.name: Wave Soda Photography Studio (WAVESODA摄影工作室)
entertainment.notes: K-pop themed photoshoot studio. Packages start from 2,388 RMB (~330 USD) including 2 costume sets, 2 indoor studio sets, 12 retouched photos. Book via WeChat in advance. Duration: 2-3 hours. Popular among couples.

entertainment.name: 海马体照相馆 (Himo Studio) - Alternative Option
entertainment.location: Multiple locations across Beijing (600 locations in 90 cities)
entertainment.notes: China's largest full-service photo studio chain. Specializes in high-end concept shoots. Website: haimati.cn. Book in advance. Various packages available. More affordable than boutique studios.

entertainment.name: 且慢 Cafe (Qieman)
entertainment.notes: Name means 'please slow down.' Calm, minimalist, ideal for quiet evening. Perfect for INFJ personality.

entertainment.name: Voyage Coffee (798店)
entertainment.location: 798 Art District, Ceramic Street 3 South Exit No.88, Chaoyang District, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Quiet cafe with independent space, industrial design, floor-to-ceiling windows, wooden furniture. Hours: 8:30-19:00. Cost: ~40 RMB per person.

entertainment.name: Capital Spirits (Baijiu Cocktail Bar)
entertainment.notes: World's first baijiu cocktail bar. Small, artistic, unique cultural experience. Perfect for couples seeking niche entertainment.

entertainment.name: 天堂时光 (Heaven Time)
entertainment.location: North Luogu Alley (北锣鼓巷), Beijing
entertainment.notes: Book and coffee shop combination. Not overly commercialized. Quiet owner who reads books, keeps cats, occasionally makes coffee. Perfect for quiet evening.

entertainment.name: 静水 (Still Water) Cafe
entertainment.notes: Street-level storefront transforms into small hutong with courtyard, tiny pond downstairs, lovely terrace upstairs. Ancient yet simple decoration. Perfect after Forbidden City visit.

entertainment.name: TIANROAST Cafe
entertainment.location: 751 D•PARK (near 798 Art District) and Dawanglu, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Playful red-hood design, minimalist wooden interiors, expertly crafted espresso. Alternative if visiting 798 Art District.

entertainment.name: Pop Mart Flagship Store (Sanlitun)
entertainment.notes: China's leading collectible toy brand. Flagship store with extensive blind box collections, Labubu characters, exclusive items. Also has Pop Land amusement park in Beijing and store at Universal Beijing Resort. Perfect for 潮玩 shopping.

entertainment.name: CJ Lounge (Rooftop Bar)
entertainment.notes: Mediterranean-style rooftop bar with 5/5 rating for views. Perfect for couples. Cost: ~150-200 RMB per person for drinks.

entertainment.name: 大小咖啡 (Daxiao Coffee)
entertainment.location: Qianfu Alley No.12, near Nanluoguxiang, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Stylish cafe with 太小空间 art exhibition space. Hosts activities in courtyard. Perfect combination with indie bookstore and cute shop exploration.

entertainment.name: SCHOOL (Livehouse Bar)
entertainment.notes: Award-winning livehouse bar (TimeOut Beijing annual bar award). Small, intimate, indie music venue. Check schedule for performances.

entertainment.name: Cafe Zarah
entertainment.location: Beijing (specific address TBD - search on maps)
entertainment.notes: Happy hour 6-8pm with friendly cocktail prices. Unexpected flavor combinations. Good for quiet evening drinks.

entertainment.name: Mona Bar
entertainment.notes: Located in quieter hutong area. Cloud-themed sofas, elegant decor. Small, intimate, artistic atmosphere. Perfect for couples seeking quiet evening entertainment.

entertainment.name: Biebox/Bacardi Bar (Rooftop)
entertainment.notes: Two rooftop spots with distinct vibes - indie culture to luxury. Spectacular city skyline views. Check which location best fits your preference.

entertainment.name: Cafe Flatwhite (798 First Branch)
entertainment.location: 798 Art District, Jiuxianqiao, Chaoyang District, Beijing
entertainment.notes: Rated 4.3/5 on Tripadvisor. Ranked #190 of 6,651 restaurants in Beijing. Good coffee in artistic 798 setting.

notes:
IMPORTANT WARNINGS AND BOOKING REQUIREMENTS:

1. DAY 8 (Feb 22) - 只此青绿 Performance: The show schedule found was for Jan 30-Feb 4, 2025. There is NO CONFIRMED performance on Feb 22, 2026. YOU MUST verify availability and book tickets by calling 010-66552100 or visiting chncpa.org at least 1-2 months in advance. If unavailable, consider alternative Beijing performances or evening activities.

2. DANCE STUDIO REGISTRATION (Day 9): Both Millennium Dance Complex and Zaha Club require advance registration. Recommend visiting websites or calling before Day 9 to ensure availability and understand foreigner registration requirements.

3. COUPLE PHOTOGRAPHY (Day 10): Wave Soda and Himo Studio both require advance booking (1-2 weeks recommended). Book via WeChat or phone. Packages cost 200-400 USD per session.

4. MASSAGE/SPA (Day 1 Chongqing): While 24-hour operation is mentioned, calling ahead is recommended after 10pm to ensure availability. Most spa packages are 200-400 RMB per person.

5. CAFES AND BARS: All cafes and bars listed are based on 2024-2025 information. Some may have relocated or closed by 2026. Recommend verifying on Dianping (大众点评) or Google Maps before visiting.

6. COST ESTIMATES: All costs in USD are approximations. Actual costs may vary based on packages, services selected, and 2026 pricing.

7. SHANGHAI ENTERTAINMENT: Additional niche cafes and quiet bars available in French Concession and Tianzifang areas. Captain Bar is near The Bund and walking distance from SK Luxury Hotel.

8. BEIJING ENTERTAINMENT DISTRIBUTION: Entertainment focused on cafes, small bars, and cultural venues matching INFJ personality preference for quiet, artistic, meaningful spaces. Avoided large clubs and loud venues. Evening activities scheduled for days with no far trips (Tue/Wed/Thu).

9. POP MART: Main flagship in Sanlitun. Additional locations at Universal Beijing Resort and Pop Land amusement park. Check opening hours before visiting.

10. REDNOTE MCP: Technical difficulties prevented RedNote verification. Recommend cross-checking all venues on Xiaohongshu (小红书) app for recent user reviews and current operating status before visiting.

11. BUDGET CONSIDERATION: Total entertainment costs estimated at ~100-150 USD per day for couple (excluding major photography session). This fits within overall budget of €1,000 for 21 days.

12. REST DAYS: Not every day has evening entertainment scheduled. Days 2-4, 6 have no additional entertainment to allow rest and recovery, especially after jet lag, travel days, and Disneyland.
